page.title: 11Local administration II.
page.content: After the parish council the next tier of local government is the district council. Ingatestone forms part of Brentwood District Council while the area to the west of the River Wid lies within the area of Chelmsford District Council. Electorally Ingatestone is a ward of Brentwood District and returns three elected district councillors. Each councillor holds his/her seat for four years hence there is a district council election three out of every four years. There is no district council election in the year when County Council elections take place. In 1985 two of the councillors are Conservative (with majorities of less than 100) and the third a Liberal with a majority of less than 200. Labour candidates generally come a poor third in elections in this well-off area.
